body: Hi all, I would like to conduct a radiation study using Honeybee for a given solar position and given direct / diffuse radiation values. I am currently using the GenCustomSky Honeybee component (see file below). I am having trouble figuring out how to use the generated sky file as a direct radiation source in a Honeybee radiation study. Here is the gh file. [honeybeeRadStudy.gh](http://api.ning.com:80/files/G5vg01Ywjqoa8wgiCWx3lotYqL5cE84J362eGP7vmTGt7D0i2s4XtiRFZkCGLsRIhM3bUaHsK27wvuvpybOI2L7bjLSULFwx/honeybeeRadStudy.gh)  I would like to use this (below) sky to determine the radiation that falls on an input geometry. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/G5vg01YwjqoVIXC2iC2y4cTMxyqCIUvop6tcStxaHmJ-TTPnW5xe5BKsIYSL2ab4JYp5oMs-OUADny5k*N2z98H114W7aZ26/climateBasedSky_7_41200_radAnalysis_skyView_f.GIF) Thank you for the help! -Mike
topic: Use Honeybee Gen Custom Sky component as a direct radiation source
